entry.title: Refactor TestFilesInstaller calls inside startHttp2TestServer
entry.content:
Similarly to QuicTestServer and NativeTestServer, let Http2TestServer

handle calls to TestFilesInstaller.installIfNeeded.



Right now Http2TestServer expects that to be called prior to

Http2TestServer.startHttp2TestServer calls. Leading to some tests

calling it and some others not, which is error prone.



Bug: b:279585863

entry.title: Reland "Implement `ExperimentalAsh` raw_ptr trait"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 07d0df3de8a7ea743a695dfd08c97cf7e2f27dd4

without the failing BackupRefPtrTest.ExperimentalAsh test



Original change's description:

> Implement `ExperimentalAsh` raw_ptr trait

>

> See the new ChromeOS ash launch plan:

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/105OVhNl-2lrfWElQSk5BXYv-nLynfxUrbC4l8cZ0CoU/edit

>

> These pointers will be evaluated in a separate finch experiment from

> PartitionAllocBackupRefPtr, and the trait is needed to differentiate

> the new raw_ptr from the existing ones.

>

entry.title: personalization: disable daily refresh for ToD
entry.content:
Per request from UX. Simply rely on the collection Id to determine

whether daily refresh is disabled. Another approach is to load the

collection and images and determine whether it's a ToD, but this will

increase the logic complexity, so the simpler approach is chosen.

entry.title: [Passwords] Refactor FindBestMatches logic.
entry.content:
The motivation behind this cl is to eliminate the usage of RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION.

The preferred_match is a convenience pointer which is always the first element in best_matches.

This extra pointer that the function is returning is thus redundant.



Bug: 1313893

entry.title: CCA: Remove "unused" spinner
entry.content:
The spinner was accidentally moved into expert mode setting in

CL:3005313, and the CSS selector is also changed in CL:3685678 to match

the wrong spinner location.



Since the spinner isn't shown at all for quite a while unless in a very

specific condition (expert mode setting is opened and camera is switched

by unplugging an external camera), and the original intention for the

spinner is for splash screen and switching camera, but both place

already have transition screen now (camera icon and blurred preview),

the spinner feels redundant. Remove it.



Bug: None

Test: manually

entry.title: WebNN: Define the CommandQueue for DirectML
entry.content:
The Direct Machine Learning (DirectML) is a low-level API for hardware

accelerated machine learning on Windows platform.



This CL defines the CommandQueue class to manage a D3D12 command queue

and provide a waitable fence which is signaled with a monotonically

increasing value once each execute completes on the GPU.



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I61c7992124adc443143ba414dcae91a6df420e4e

entry.title: [Files]: Search metadata rather than content in Google Drive
entry.content:
For users that have large files in Google Drive search by content is

quite slow. In addition we can find files that do not have names

matching the query, which is confusing to users. This CL switches to

search by metadata (name, modified date, category).



In addition, we add entryCallbackCaller function to enable async response from multiple volumes. The success callback is still called

when all search promises are settled, but entry callbacks are called

as soon as search result from a given promise are available.



Metadata rather than content search demo:

http://screencast/cast/NTc0MDYzNjU0MTAyNjMwNHw0M2NmOWE1YS02OA



Async results demo:

http://screencast/cast/NjcxNjE4ODgzNTk3MTA3MnwwYjNiMmZiYy0zMw



Bug: b:255520067, b:280247176, b:280548057

entry.title: cros: Refactor AuthEventsRecorder::OnLoginSuccess
entry.content:
Pass all the user info (is_new_user/is_login_offline/is_ephemeral) as

part of the `OnLoginSuccess` call to simplify setting the user

login type.



Use `IsUserCryptohomeDataEphemeral` instead of the

`kAccountsPrefEphemeralUsersEnabled` pref to specify whether the user

is ephemeral.

entry.title: Suppress repetitive errors for libs not available in stack tool
entry.content:
tools/python/llvm_symbolizer.py generates error logs, which when

called from the stack symbolization scripts can produce a lot of

unhelpful logs, notably the error logged when the |lib| parameter

of |GetSymbolInformation| is not valid:

"Can't run llvm-symbolizer! Given binary is not a valid target. path=%s"

See for instance these logs:

https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=61a979f2cac67b10&w=true



This intents to silence most of those errors, especially for the test

bots, by updating the stack tool:

third_party/android_platform/development/scripts/stack et al.

This prevent calls to |GetSymbolInformation| if:

- the library is not a .so file

- the library is not a valid file

Logs are produced only if the script is run in verbose mode.



Bug: 1340999

Change-Id: I36e21e6f0567809297e83002722743dda30288f3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4444157

Reviewed-by: Andrew Grieve

Commit-Queue: Pâris Meuleman

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1139389}

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Fix crash on settings page with notify negative space
entry.content:
When the OnBulkPinProgress takes a long time and there is not a lot of

disk space the calculation for remaining space can enter negative

territory. This is sent to the UI by first trying to format the int64 to

a string. It crashes when it tries to format a negative value. To avoid

this, use the empty string to indicate invalid value, if this is

returned the UI will not show the value at all and on the next iteration

the PinManager will stop with kNotEnoughSpace.



Bug: b:280553283

entry.title: FinalizeAfterImport: Don't distinguish between (un)verified profiles.
entry.content:
When migrating a legacy structure, FinalizeAfterImport() sets the

verification status to either kUserVerified or kObserved, depending on

whether the profile is verified. This CL drops this distinction and

sets the verification status to kObserved in either case.

entry.title: Revert "[Preloads,Dedupe] Reduce invalid traffic to server."
entry.content:
This reverts commit b017c386afa0eb5a7f1a2f03824308404bbd77ee.



Reason for revert: This CL is likely the cause for failure AppDeduplicationServiceAlmanacTest.ServiceDisabledInTestsWhenTestModeIsOff and

AppPreloadServiceTest.ServiceDisabledInTestsWhenTestModeIsOff in linux-chromeos-chrome builder starting from https://ci.chromium.org/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-chrome/32534



Original change's description:

> [Preloads,Dedupe] Reduce invalid traffic to server.

>

> The server is getting high traffic of queries with invalid API

> keys. To fix this, we verify that the build is using the official

> Google-internal file containing the official API keys for preloads

> and dedupe to run. Otherwise there is no point to instantiate

> the services, as any queries to the server with an invalid API

> key will fail.

>

> Bug: b/280374997

> Change-Id: Ib994bc87218bf61fde3ea05602983338257b15fc

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4495756

entry.title: CCA: Update frame reading for time lapse recording
entry.content:
Previously, we use requestVideoFrameCallback function from

HTMLVideoElement to subscribe to a new frame. However, the callback

does not work when the app window is not active (e.g. window is

minimized, or another full-screen window is active). So, we changed to

continuously read frames from the track processor instead.



Also, test basic start, stop, and pause/resume.



Bug: b:280392334, b:236800499

Test: Manually, by start recording, open another app, and stop later.

Change-Id: I1fbae8976510e3d74c99e171e81620eddb5ec4b3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4502287

Reviewed-by: Wei Lee

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1139369}

entry.title: WebNN: Define XNNPACK Node for prelu
entry.content:
This CL implements DefineXnnNodeForPRelu() method that defines XNNPACK

prelu Node by xnn_define_prelu(). Currently, this CL only supports slope

whose dimensions are all 1 except the last dimension and the value of

the last dimension must be the same as the input.



For unit tests, this CL implements PReluTest of MLGraphTest that

checks the compute results of prelu operators.



Bug: 1273291

Reason for revert: This CL is likely the cause for the failed test external/wpt/css/css-text-decor/text-shadow/standards-decor-noblur-2.html on builder mac11-arm64-rel-tests, starting from https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac11-arm64-rel-tests/18057. > Fix painting order of text-shadow on (underline) decorations

>

> The right-most shadow should be at the bottom, so needs to be painted

> first (c.f. `TextPainterBase::CreateDrawLooper()`).

entry.title: autocorrect: ensure ac override honors pref set
entry.content:
Currently we override the autocorrect_enabled value sent to the IME

service when certain experimental conditions are not met. This override

has two issues in its logic;



1. It is not fully guarded by the relevant autocorrect experiment

flag.

2. It does not take any explicit user preference set by the user for

autocorrect into account.



This CL fixes the issue by adding in the required flag guard, and

the logic to honor the autocorrect preference explicitly set by the user.



BUG=b:280519996

entry.title: Implement navigation queueing for navigation requests with no url loader
entry.content:
This implements the same basic strategy that was used for 'regular'

navigations. The code for picking a RenderFrameHost for this navigation

path has already been extracted out into its own helper method, so if

`GetFrameHostForNavigation()` fails, simply bind a resume commit closure

to call reinvoke the helper method later.



This also extends the tests to provide coverage for this updated

navigation path and removes a "no render frame host" check that should

no longer be reachable–while there is theoretically another

`GetFrameHostForNavigation()` return path that can fail if the render

process cannot be initialized, this can never happen in practice–and

more importantly, it was never handled before and should not be expected

to "just work".



Bug: 1220337

entry.title: inputs: Fix reset bug in surrounding text tracker.
entry.content:
There was a misunderstanding about "reset". "reset" in the ChromeOS IME

code means "reset composition": the input field has decided to cancel

the composition (e.g. the user has right clicked).



The surrounding text tracker thought "reset" meant resetting the entire

state, including surrounding text etc. This can cause the surrounding

text tracker to be out-of-sync with the actual surrounding text.



An example where this causes problems:

1. User selects some text.

2. User right clicks the selection. This causes a "reset". The

surrounding text tracker resets everything, but the actual

surrounding text remains the same as before.

3. User presses the Escape key. This calls ConfirmComposition. Because

the surrounding text tracker is now out-of-sync, the

ConfirmComposition fails and the selection is deleted.



Bug: b/267944900,1434957

Change-Id: I217dd441fc3f634ff00a4006c8e06ecb563c8b48

entry.title: [Preloads,Dedupe] Reduce invalid traffic to server.
entry.content:
The server is getting high traffic of queries with invalid API

keys. To fix this, we verify that the build is using the official

Google-internal file containing the official API keys for preloads

and dedupe to run. Otherwise there is no point to instantiate

the services, as any queries to the server with an invalid API

key will fail.

entry.title: [fedcm] Expose the opening of the Modal Dialog in the UI controller
entry.content:
In this CL, we introduce a new method, ShowModalDialog

in the IdentityDialogController, so that it can be invoked from the

FederatedAuthRequestImpl class.



This allows the same implementation of the modal dialog to be reused

between the IdP Sign-in Status API and the AuthZ API, since both

need a modal dialog that load content from the IdP.



This CL also renames the Show()/Close() method to be IdP Sign-in

Status API agnostic, so that it can be used outside of its flow.

entry.title: Revert "Switch PageDiscardingHelper to get background feature use from SiteData"
entry.content:
Partial revert of commit 5007b916f1e92e9b6d78092d239be947e9627b21.



Reason for revert: Regressed pages which rarely use background features.



Some pages only update the title while in the background in rare cases

(eg. Google Docs will update it if another user edits the title of a

shared doc.) SiteData saves this information for a long time so if

this is observed once the site will never be discarded. This reverts

to the M113 behaviour of only blocking discards if the behaviour is

observed in the current session.



Does not revert an IWYU fix in user_performance_tuning_manager.cc, or

internal changes to SiteDataRecorder to make it more testable.



Original change's description:

> Switch PageDiscardingHelper to get background feature use from SiteData

>

> PageDiscardingHelper now finds a SiteDataReader for the PageNode to

> check if the page title or favicon were updated in the background.

>

> Also includes some refactoring for the browser test:

>

> * Adds a SiteDataRecorderHeuristics class for SiteDataRecorder that

> can be mocked in tests. SiteDataRecorder checks some heuristics,

> such as the time since a page was moved to the background, to

> decide whether to record background title and favicon updates or

> ignore them. This moves all these heuristics to a policy class that

> can be overridden in tests because some of them are hard to satisfy

> in browser tests.

> * Adds some more strict state checking so that

> SiteDataRecorder::OnLoadingStateChanged() only updates the internal

> state when the loading state actually changed. The code happened to

> work with the default heuristics because it was never called with

> two states where IsLoadedIdle() returned true in a row.

> * Splits the PageDiscardingHelper browser test into a separate test

> for each feature, since the browser must now be restarted to clear

> the SiteData DB between each test.

>

> And some misc cleanups:

>

> * Remove GetPageNodeLiveStateData which was never used.

> * Moves all checks in CanDiscardResult() that don't need

> PageLiveState data or a SiteDataReader to the top of the function.

> * Fixes an IWYU violation in user_performance_tuning_manager.cc.

> * Moves private SiteDataRecorder constants into the anonymous

> namespace.

>

> R=anthonyvd

>

> Bug: 1426484

> Change-Id: I6a90bd81d7421bd50fe5269e254fc97fe9dec93f

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Wire up not enough space state
entry.content:
NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE is returned when the local disk space is insufficient

to store all the users My drive files. When this happens the cloud panel

enters into a not enough space state indicating as such to the user.

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Don't show Pinned toggle when bulk pinning enabled

items available offline. This hides the toggle entirely when the flag is

enabled and the preference is enabled. Note in the event of any such

error the preference will get disabled, so this serves as the correct

signal.

entry.title: [ComputePressure] Do not crash when only the Blink feature is enabled
entry.content:
The root cause for the crash issue is that: if experimental web

platform features flag is enabled but chrome is launched without

"--enable-features=ComputePressure" flag, then user can access

Compute Pressure API but the IPC from Blink to browser is not

working.



This CL fixes the crash issue by checking if the Compute Pressure

API is enabled in Blink before IPC.



Bug: 1435444

entry.title: Simplify GPUExternalTexture expiry mechanism on HTMLVideoElement case
entry.content:
GPUExternalTexture has two cache refresh entry point for

HTMLVideoElement.



One is a repeated callback registered in ScriptedAnimationController,

the other is triggered by importExternalTexture() call.



This CL removes the repeated callback to unify the cache refresh

entry point to avoid unexpected multiple destroy situation.



The CL also do some clean ups.



Bug: 1430497

entry.title: [CrOS Hotspot] Add hotspot info cache
entry.content:
Querying the hotspot info is asynchronous, but quick settings needs to

know the state synchronously when constructing its bubble. Create a

cache of the hotspot info, initially populated at system start, so quick

settings can query it synchronously.

entry.title: [MediaFoundation] Audio and Video ConfigChange tracing
entry.content:
OS: Win

This task is to add more tracing for config changes. Currently there

are no tracing related to config change when Media Foundation is

enabled. Better tracing would enable easier analysis of on the fly

config changes such as codec changes.



This CL will add tracing for config change in Audio and Video streams

when MojoDemuxerStreamAdapter is used.

entry.title: App Management: Add 'details' field for publisher permission status
entry.content:
This adds a new string field to the App Service permission type for

storing publisher-specific details about the permission value (e.g.

whether a permission is available in the background, or what types of

storage access an app has). This allows publishers to document

additional publisher-specific behavior without bloating the app service

APIs.



The detail string is shown for allowed permissions in the read-only

permissions list in App Management.

entry.title: cros_next: Add MaterialNext dialog (part 1)
entry.content:
This cl adds the system dialog view that has the MaterialNext

style.



The system dialog may have an icon, a title, description,

additional content, and a button container. The button container

typically has an accept and a cancel buttons, but it can also

have an additional view.



The bounds of the system dialog will be automatically adjusted

according to its parent bounds. This part will be implemented in

the following CL (part 2).



The examples are shown in the bug comments.

entry.title: Settings: Make settings-secure-dns not depend on settings-shared style.
entry.content:
- Change 'secondary' CSS class to 'cr-secondary-text'

- Remove 'list-item' and 'list-frame' CSS classes, and replace with

targeted styles for the elements that used them.



This also fixes a bug where the settings-secure-dns element would

invisibly extend outside the boundaries of the enclosing card,

noticeable only when hovering the cursor over that area.



This is in preparation of moving it to the "limited sharing" mechanism

so that it can be properly shared between OS and Browser Settings.

entry.title: video-conference:Fix strangely laid out UI
entry.content:
With LaCrOS enabled, the UI was missing padding.



It turns out that in LaCrOS, there is an async call.



This async call means views are added after the bubble view has

already called `SizeToContents()`.



Ensure a modification to the view hierarchy after the async call is

accompanied by a call to PreferredSizeChanged(), this fixes the

layout issue.



Bug: b:273814401

move operations don't use the copy ctor.

entry.title: Handle double-downloads in bisect-builds.py
entry.content:
When running this bisect command, to verify a bisect:



tools\bisect-builds.py -g 991339 -b 991352 -a win64 --verify-range



an error was hit during cleanup. This happened because build 991339 was

downloaded twice, which happens because a --verify-range build downloads

three builds initially, and this range only contains two builds. The

same download gets deleted twice and the second deletion attempt fails.

This failure then causes a file to be left behind because the cleanup

process is halted. The error is:



File "tools\bisect-builds.py", line 776, in Stop

os.unlink(self.zip_file)

FileNotFoundError: [WinError 2] The system cannot find the file specified: '991339-chrome-win32.zip'



The simplest fix is to make duplicate-deletion not an error. This

ensures that cleanup is done properly.



This error was hit on Windows. It is unknown whether it would be an

error on other operating systems.



Bug: 1430979

entry.title: [wayland] Switch WaylandWindow subclasses to use WaylandZAuraSurface
entry.content:
This CL transitions WaylandToplevelWindow and WaylandPopup from

independently implementing and owning the zaura_surface object to

using the WaylandZAuraSurface wrapper owned by WaylandSurface.



This simplifies the implementation of the extension interface

client-side. The surface extension is now owned directly by the

WaylandSurface (as with other surface extensions). This makes

lifetime easier to reason about and makes extensions to commit

state easier to integrate with WaylandSurface::State.



WaylandWindow has been made a WaylandZAuraSurface::Delegate these

methods are overridden by the window subclasses as needed to handle

surface extension events from the server.



Bug: 1436871

FormFillerJavaScriptTest's ctor into SetUp().



- Make InitializeSDK() take an extra parameter `use_skia`. This

enables FormFillerJavaScriptTest to use GetParam() to switch

between AGG and Skia renderer for testing.

entry.title: Make partitioned service workers only send cookies from their partition
entry.content:
Before this change, workers would use partitioned cookies from their own site's partition in network requests from service workers. This could allow sites to join state across different partitions.



For first-party partitioned/unpartitioned workers, the resulting IsolationInfo's top-level and current origin is the worker origin. Site for cookies ends up being the site of the worker origin.



For third-party partitioned workers, the top-level origin is derived from StorageKey's top-frame site. In these contexts, SFC is null.



This CL does *not* ensure partitioning bounds for cookies sent in service worker script requests. I will be adding that in a follow-up CL.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Simplify V4L2PixFmtToVideoCodecProfiles()
entry.content:
Said method uses a local get_supported_profiles() lambda, that is

based on a VideoCodec parameter |codec|. Said |codec| is first

translated to a V4L2 V4L2_CID_MPEG_VIDEO_...PROFILE identifier; this

is unnecessary since all callsites of said lambda are in the same

function and they know perfectly well how to use the CID directly.

This CL does that, simplifying the code. The static

V4L2ProfileToVideoCodecProfile() function is modified

correspondingly.



No new functionality intended.
